channel.title: MySQL Speed Question
channel.description: Hi, I'm making a private server, but this question isn't focused solely on the server. I'm basically loading data from a MySQL Database, but i was wondering if it would be faster if i loaded it from a file. Like instead of loading the info from a table, loading it from a file. Would it be faster, or would it really depend on the application?

item.title: MySQL Speed Question
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It’s not just for character info. I’m planning on it having Character info, item info, object info, npc info, skill rates, expereince, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Speed Question
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:9, topic:265458”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=350466.msg2694517#msg2694517 date=1236181439]

It would probably be faster loading it from a database.

how could a database possibly be faster,
consider:
you are connecting to it by socket, using ssl
it has to parse the query
then read the file unless its stored in memory which is probably not the case when theres a lot of data

i really doubt mysql could beat pure file speed

But take into consideration the organization of a database and the very fast execution of queries versus the parsing of normal files. Some format must be imposed for the particular file that you are using to store whatever data you wish. And, if you have enough information to fill a database, then surely you would have many, many files to worry about if you don’t use a sql database.
[/quote]
hes making a private server. most likely, he just wants to store user info. why would you need to parse the file when its just serialized information? also, parsing a file would still be faster as sql has to parse the query which is more complex[/quote]if someone with half a brain were to make a server, sql ould be the fastest and easiest way to access data

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Speed Question
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:8, topic:265458”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=350466.msg2694219#msg2694219 date=1236141700]

It would probably be faster loading it from a database.

how could a database possibly be faster,
consider:
you are connecting to it by socket, using ssl
it has to parse the query
then read the file unless its stored in memory which is probably not the case when theres a lot of data

i really doubt mysql could beat pure file speed
[/quote]

But take into consideration the organization of a database and the very fast execution of queries versus the parsing of normal files. Some format must be imposed for the particular file that you are using to store whatever data you wish. And, if you have enough information to fill a database, then surely you would have many, many files to worry about if you don’t use a sql database.[/quote]
hes making a private server. most likely, he just wants to store user info. why would you need to parse the file when its just serialized information? also, parsing a file would still be faster as sql has to parse the query which is more complex

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Speed Question
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:6, topic:265458”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=350466.msg2692467#msg2692467 date=1236040833]
It would probably be faster loading it from a database.
[/quote]
how could a database possibly be faster,
consider:
you are connecting to it by socket, using ssl
it has to parse the query
then read the file unless its stored in memory which is probably not the case when theres a lot of data

i really doubt mysql could beat pure file speed[/quote]

But take into consideration the organization of a database and the very fast execution of queries versus the parsing of normal files. Some format must be imposed for the particular file that you are using to store whatever data you wish. And, if you have enough information to fill a database, then surely you would have many, many files to worry about if you don’t use a sql database.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL Speed Question
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:6, topic:265458”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=350466.msg2692467#msg2692467 date=1236040833]
It would probably be faster loading it from a database.
[/quote]
how could a database possibly be faster,
consider:
you are connecting to it by socket, using ssl
it has to parse the query
then read the file unless its stored in memory which is probably not the case when theres a lot of data

i really doubt mysql could beat pure file speed[/quote]
It doesn’t.

Databases are used over files though because it’s easy to modify or expand a database, whereas it’s harder to modify a file after the original design.

Read full topic
